title: There needs to be more transparency leading up to a perma-ban
body:
So just experienced having my main account perma-banned. Realistically, probably a long time coming. Numerous chat restrictions, mostly due to going through an extremely difficult time in my life and some players testing my mental stability. 

I had been working hard on reforming and had improved my behaviour. No restrictions for quite sometime. Progressing my way back up to Diamond and in my promos I had one guy boasting that he was account sharing and playing on his friends account. After some bullying and verbal abuse towards me I got frustrated and gave a bit back.

This is what cost me my ~$800 account. No lead up warning, no "you are getting dangerously close", just there goes your account. Needless to say I was disappointed. I know I had misbehaved in the past, but in all honesty, considering I never intentionally fed, never AFK'd and never acted not in retaliation, I feel like I wasn't anywhere near as bad as the majority of players I come across. To be honest if my actions were bad enough to get perma-banned then literally ~70% of the players I come across should not have their accounts. 

I know each time you get a restriction it states "repeat offences can result in permanent punishment", but it had been such a long time since I received any punishment and figured my account "karma" was heading towards a positive grading. I personally think that the account should be notified when close to such a severe punishment. 

I am in no way stating that my behaviour didn't warrant a punishment under Riots strict policy (it was literally just some swearing). It just would have been nice to have some heads up that's all. I'd state that I will not be spending any money on any of my accounts but what does Riot care, they've already got most of my money from my banned account.
